It belongs to the family Restionaceae, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid and coastal environments. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in spikes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Gomphia congesta is well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in coastal areas with high salinity and strong winds.
